org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.requests

Class AsyncRequest<RESPONSE_TYPE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.requests.AsyncRequest<RESPONSE_TYPE>
  • Type Parameters:
    RESPONSE_TYPE - The type of response value.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsyncResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE>, Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppBase.AsyncBladeRequest, BladeBase.AsyncBladeRequest, DelayAReq, IncDesImpl.AsyncBladeRequest, SubscribeAReq, TransactionAReq

    public abstract class AsyncRequest<RESPONSE_TYPE>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>, AsyncResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE>
    An async request separates data flow from control flow and its effect can span multiple reactors.

      Create an AsyncRequest and bind it to its target targetReactor.

        Create an AsyncRequest and bind it to its target targetReactor.
        Parameters:
        _targetReactor - The targetReactor where this AsyncRequest Objects is passed for processing. The thread owned by this targetReactor will process this AsyncRequest.

      • processAsyncResponse

        public void processAsyncResponse(RESPONSE_TYPE _response)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncResponseProcessor
        The processAsyncResponse method accepts the response of a request.

        This method need not be thread-safe, as it is always invoked from the same light-weight thread (targetReactor) that passed the AsyncRequest and AsyncResponseProcessor objects.

        Specified by:
        processAsyncResponse in interface AsyncResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Parameters:
        _response - The response to a request.

      • signal

        public void signal()
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Passes this Request to the target Reactor without any result being passed back. I.E. The signal method results in a 1-way message being passed. If an exception is thrown while processing this Request, that exception is simply logged as a warning.
        Specified by:
        signal in interface Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>

      • call

        public RESPONSE_TYPE call()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Passes this request and then blocks the source thread until the request has been returned with a response value. This method can not be called within the thread context of a reactor.
        Specified by:
        call in interface Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Returns:
        The result value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isCanceled

        public boolean isCanceled()
                   throws ReactorClosedException
        Description copied from interface: Request

        Returns true if the request has been canceled. Closing the source reactor, for example, will result in the request being canceled. This method should ideally be called periodically within long loops.

        A check is also made to see if the request is closed. If processing continues for any length of time after the request is closed, then a hung thread can result and a recovery process is initiated. To avoid this, call isCanceled withing any loops. It will throw an ReactorClosedException if the request is closed.

        Specified by:
        isCanceled in interface Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Returns:
        True if the request has been canceled.
        Throws:
        ReactorClosedException - Thrown when the request is closed.

      • processAsyncRequest

        public abstract void processAsyncRequest()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        The processAsyncRequest method will be invoked by the target Reactor on its own thread.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • onCancel

        public void onCancel()
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been canceled. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. The default action of onCancel is to call cancelAll and, if the reactor is not a common reactor, sends a response of null via a bound response processor.

      • onClose

        public void onClose()
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been closed. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. By default, onClose does nothing.

      • setNoHungRequestCheck

        protected void setNoHungRequestCheck()
        Disables the hung request check, which is necessary when a response to a request is not passed back until another request is received.

      • getPendingResponseCount

        public int getPendingResponseCount()
        Returns the number of outstanding requests.
        Returns:
        The number of outstanding requests.

      • processAsyncException

        public void processAsyncException(java.lang.Exception _response)
        Passes back an exception as a response instead of throwing it. But regardless of how a response is returned, if the response is an exception it is passed to the exception handler of the async request that did the send or has the invoking call method throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        _response - An exception.

      • send

        public <RT> void send(Request<RT> _request,
                      AsyncResponseProcessor<RT> _responseProcessor)
        Pass a request to its target reactor.
        Type Parameters:
        RT - The response value type.
        Parameters:
        _request - The request to be passed.
        _responseProcessor - The callback to be invoked when a response value is received, or null if no response is required.

      • send

        public <RT,RT2> void send(Request<RT> _request,
                          AsyncResponseProcessor<RT2> _dis,
                          RT2 _fixedResponse)
        Pass a request to its target and then replace its response value. Useful when you do not care about the actual response being passed back.
        Type Parameters:
        RT - The response value type.
        RT2 - The replacement value type.
        Parameters:
        _request - The request to be passed.
        _dis - The callback to be invoked when a response value is received.
        _fixedResponse - The replacement value.

      • setExceptionHandler

        public ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> setExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> _exceptionHandler)
        Replace the current ExceptionHandler with another.
        Parameters:
        _exceptionHandler - The exception handler to be used now. May be null if the default exception handler is to be used.
        Returns:
        The exception handler that was previously in effect, or null if the default exception handler was in effect.

      • cancel

        public boolean cancel(Request _request)
        Cancel an outstanding request. This method is thread safe, so it can be called from any thread.
        Parameters:
        _request - A subordinate request.
        Returns:
        True if the request was canceled.

      • cancelAll

        public void cancelAll()
        Cancels all outstanding requests. This method is thread safe, so it can be called from any thread.
